metadata.title: CVE-2016-4485 on Ubuntu 14.04 ESM (trusty) - medium
metadata.description:
The llc_cmsg_rcv function in net/llc/af_llc.c in the Linux kernel before4.5.5 does not initialize a certain data structure, which allows attackersto obtain sensitive information from kernel stack memory by reading amessage.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2016-4485` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-3.13.0-87-generic - 3.13.0-87.133
linux-image-3.13.0-87-generic-lpae - 3.13.0-87.133
linux-image-3.13.0-87-lowlatency - 3.13.0-87.133

linux-image-3.13.0-87-powerpc-e500mc - 3.13.0-87.133

linux-image-3.13.0-87-powerpc64-emb - 3.13.0-87.133
linux-image-3.13.0-87-powerpc64-smp - 3.13.0-87.133
linux-image-extra-3.13.0-87-generic - 3.13.0-87.133
No subscription required

criterions.comment: linux package in trusty was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '3.13.0-87.133').
linux-goldfish: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue.

linux-aws package in trusty, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-1002.2').
